A Latin Dictionary by Charlton T. Lewis and Charles Short was first published in 1879 and is now in the public domain. It is one of the most extensive Latin dictionaries in the English language.


This version of the dictionary was digitized by the Perseus Digital Library at Tufts University, under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 United States License. The xml data files are available at https://github.com/PerseusDL/lexica.


This app is Open Source, under the MIT License. The source code is available at https://github.com/ids1024/lsdict-android.
